meanings.definition: An ornamental style of decoration using rock and shell motifs.
meanings.sent1: The garden was adorned with rocaille sculptures made of rocks and shells.
meanings.sent2: The rocaille design on the fireplace added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent3: The artist created a rocaille masterpiece using colorful rocks and delicate shells.
meanings.sent4: Her jewelry box was a rocaille treasure chest filled with precious stones and seashells.
meanings.sent5: The intricate rocaille patterns on the ceiling made it look like a magical underwater cave.

meanings.definition: A style of architecture characterized by elaborate ornamentation.
meanings.sent1: The rocaille architecture of the palace featured intricate carvings and detailed decorations.
meanings.sent2: Visitors marveled at the rocaille details on the columns of the building.
meanings.sent3: The rocaille building looked like a gingerbread house come to life.
meanings.sent4: The rocaille facade of the church sparkled in the sunlight like a jewel.
meanings.sent5: The rocaille style of architecture transformed the city into a fairy tale land.

meanings.definition: A type of decorative art popular in the 18th century.
meanings.sent1: The rocaille paintings in the museum captured the essence of the 18th century.
meanings.sent2: Art collectors sought after rocaille pieces to add to their collections.
meanings.sent3: The rocaille artwork was like a time machine to the elegant 18th century.
meanings.sent4: The rocaille designs on the furniture reflected the opulence of the era.
meanings.sent5: Walking through the rocaille exhibit felt like stepping back in time to a lavish period.
